str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A soldier. From a presumed derivative of the same as stratia; a camper-out, i.e. A warrior.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To weave together, plait, twist, braid. A primary word; to twine or braid.
A crown, garland, honor, glory. From an apparently primary stepho; a chaplet, literally or figuratively.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
A thorn-bush, prickly plant; a thorn. Probably from the same as akmen; a thorn.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To put, place upon, lay on; I add, give in addition. From epi and tithemi; to impose.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the primary kapto; the head, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From peri and ballo; to throw all around, i.e. Invest.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Purple. From porphura; purpureal, i.e. Bluish red.
A long flowing outer garment, tunic. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi; a dress.
